title: NACC Uniform Data Set (UDS) – Initial Visit Packet--Form C1: MMSE and Neuropsychological Battery
description:
NOTE: This form is to be completed by ADC or clinic staff. For test administrationADC Visit #:__ __ __
and scoring, see UDS Coding Guidebook for Initial Visit Packet, Form C1.
KEY: If the subject cannot complete any of the following exams, please use
the following codes for test scores (except for the Trail Making Test):
95 = Physical problem 97 = Other problem
96 = Cognitive/behavior problem 98 = Verbal refusal

MMSELOC.title: 1A The administration of the MMSE was:

MMSELANX.title: 1A2 Language of MMSE, other – specify
MMSELANX.description: Any text or numbers but cannot use single quotes (‘), double quotes (“), ampersands (&), or percentage signs (%). Blank if #1A1, MMSELAN ≠ 3 (Other).

MMSEORDA.title: 1B1 MMSE orientation subscale score, time
MMSEORDA.description: (0-5, 95-98), 95/995 = Physical problem 96/996 = Cognitive/behavior problem 97/997 = Other problem 98/998 = Verbal refusal

MMSEORLO.title: 1B2 MMSE orientation subscale score, place
MMSEORLO.description: (0-5, 95-98), 95/995 = Physical problem 96/996 = Cognitive/behavior problem 97/997 = Other problem 98/998 = Verbal refusal

NPSYCLOC.title: 2 The remainder of the battery was administered:

NPSYLANX.title: 2A1 Language of test (neuropsychological battery), other – specify
NPSYLANX.description: Any text or numbers but cannot use single quotes (‘), double quotes (“) ampersands (&), or percentage signs (%). Blank if #2A, NPSYLAN ≠ 3 (Other).

LOGIMO.title: 3a. If this test has been administered to the subject within the past three months, specify the date previously administered
LOGIMO.description: Date can be submitted as YYYY-MM-DD,(Current Year or Previous Year)

LOGIPREV.title: 3B Total score from the previous test administration:

LOGIMEM.title: 3C Total number of story units recalled from this current test administration:

DIGIF.title: 4A Total number of trials correct prior to two consecutive errors at the same digit length:

DIGIB.title: 5A Total number of trials correct prior to two consecutive errors at the same digit length:

ANIMALS.title: 6A Category fluency, Animals – Total number of animals named in 60 seconds:

VEG.title: 6B Category fluency, Vegetables – Total number of vegetables named in 60 seconds:

TRAILA.title: 7A Part A – Total number of seconds to complete (if not finished by 150 seconds, enter 150):
TRAILA.description: (0-150, 995-998)(if not finished by 150 seconds, enter 150):(If test not completed, enter reason code, 995-998, and SKIP TO QUESTION 8b)

TRAILB.title: 7B Part B – Total number of seconds to complete (if not finished by 300 seconds, enter 300):
TRAILB.description: (0-300, 995-998)(if not finished by 300 seconds, enter 300): (If test not completed, enter reason code, 995-998, and SKIP TO QUESTION 9a)

WAIS.title: 8A Total number of items correctly completed in 90 seconds:

MEMUNITS.title: 9A Logical Memory IIA – Delayed: Total number of story units recalled:

MEMTIME.title: 9B Logical Memory IIA – Delayed: Time elapsed since Logical Memory IA –Immediate: (minutes)

BOSTON.title: 10A Boston Naming Test – (30 Odd-numbered items) total score:

COGSTAT.title: 11A Based on the neuropsychological examination, the subject’s cognitive status is deemed:
enum: 3 One or two test scores abnormal
4 Most test scores are abnormal or lower than expected
